io.s4.client
Class Adapter

java.lang.Object
  io.s4.client.Adapter

public class Adapter
extends java.lang.Object

Adapter to connect an S4 cluster to an external client to read from and write into the S4 cluster.

setClusterEventListener

public void setClusterEventListener(EventListener clusterEventListener)
clusterEventListener receives events from S4 cluster. Processing of events is delegated to the eventReader, which typically forwards them to appropriate clients.

Parameters:
clusterEventListener -

init

public void init()

setInputStubs

public void setInputStubs(java.util.List<InputStub> stubs)
Register a list of InputStubs that will send events into the S4 cluster. These events will be processed by the eventWriter: i.e. the eventWriter dispatches them into the S4 cluster.

Parameters:
stubs -

setOutputStubs

public void setOutputStubs(java.util.List<OutputStub> stubs)
Register a list of OutputStubs which process events received from the S4 cluster, typically forwarding them to clients. The OutputStub.getAcceptedStreams() is called to determine which streams the stub is interested in receiving. Accordingly, three collections of stubs are created.
  1. A mapping from stream name to OutputStubs (One-to-many). Used for routing.
  2. A list of OutputStubs that accept all streams ( stub.getAcceptedStreams() == null. Used for routing.
  3. A list of all OutputStubs. This is used to iterate over all the stubs exactly once.

Parameters:
stubs - the list of output stubs.
